TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit JapaneseLunisolarCalendar extends System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar

Docs.summary: Represents time in divisions, such as months, days, and years. Years are calculated as for the Japanese calendar, while days and months are calculated using the lunisolar calendar.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The JapaneseLunisolarCalendar class is derived from the <xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar> class, which represents the lunisolar calendar. The <xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar> class supports the sexagenary year cycle (which repeats every 60 years) in addition to solar years and lunar months. Each solar year in the calendar is associated with a Sexagenary Year, a Celestial Stem, and a Terrestrial Branch, and these calendars can have leap months after any month of the year.
> [!NOTE] > For information about using the JapaneseLunisolarCalendar class and the other calendar classes in the .NET Framework, see [Working with Calendars](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md).
For example, the <xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar.GetMonth%2A> method returns a number between 1 and 13 that indicates the month associated with a specified date. If there is a leap month between the eighth and ninth months of the year, the <xref:System.Globalization.EastAsianLunisolarCalendar.GetMonth%2A> method returns 8 for the eighth month, 9 for the leap eighth month, and 10 for the ninth month.
Currently, the JapaneseLunisolarCalendar is not used by any of the cultures supported by the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> class. Therefore, this class can be used only to calculate dates in the Japanese lunisolar calendar.
Each <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo> object supports a set of calendars. The <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.Calendar%2A> property returns the default calendar for the culture, and the <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.OptionalCalendars%2A> property returns an array containing all the calendars supported by the culture. To change the calendar used by a <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo>, the application should set the <xref:System.Globalization.DateTimeFormatInfo.Calendar%2A> property of <xref:System.Globalization.CultureInfo.DateTimeFormat%2A?displayProperty=fullName> to a new <xref:System.Globalization.Calendar>.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets the number of days in the year that precedes the year that is specified by the <xref:System.Globalization.JapaneseLunisolarCalendar.MinSupportedDateTime%2A> property.
Docs.value: The number of days in the year that precedes the year specified by <xref:System.Globalization.JapaneseLunisolarCalendar.MinSupportedDateTime%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This property returns a constant value of 354.

Docs.summary: Gets the eras that are relevant to the object.
Docs.value: An array of 32-bit signed integers that specify the relevant eras.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The values in the array returned by this property are numbers that range from 1 to the largest era number. The largest era number is returned in the first array element and the smallest era number is returned in the last element.
The Eras property returns the same values as the <xref:System.Globalization.JapaneseCalendar.Eras%2A> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance int32 GetEra(valuetype System.DateTime time) cil managed

Docs.summary: Retrieves the era that corresponds to the specified <xref:System.DateTime>.
Docs.returns: An integer that represents the era specified in the parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The value of this field is 1.

Docs.summary: Gets the maximum date and time supported by the class.
Docs.value: The latest date and time supported by the class, which is equivalent to the last moment of January 22, 2050 C.E. in the Gregorian calendar.

Docs.summary: Gets the minimum date and time supported by the class.
Docs.value: The earliest date and time supported by the class, which is equivalent to the first moment of January 28, 1960 C.E. in the Gregorian calendar.
